definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
pooh/pah/bah/(today used as a phonetic component in 部[bu4], 倍[bei4], 培[pei2], 剖[pou1] etc)
to ask for compensation/to claim damages/claim for damages
to settle a claim/claims settlement/payment of claims
to lose money/to pay for damages
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: to offer an apology/to make amends

sentences.english: Fire is good merchandise, credit is a collective, once pressed the library, pay out compensation.
sentences.chinese: 火了是好貨，功勞屬集體，一旦壓了庫，工資往外賠。

sentences.english: I broke the glass, so I'll pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃是我打碎的，由我來賠。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the design of insurance company underwriting system.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了保險公司覈保核賠系統的設計。

sentences.english: It compensates wealths with him side take off and exempt.
sentences.chinese: 又與他賠了些錢財，方得脫免。

sentences.english: If be in, divide except authority is stock compensate poundage bought to be opposite before breath?
sentences.chinese: 假如在除權除息前買股票賠手續費對嗎？

sentences.english: Whatever you earn and loss you suck it up, SO it is big risk.
sentences.chinese: 賺了賠了都是您自個兒的，風險挺大。

sentences.english: The insurance company insures Risk of Breakages with 5% franchise.
sentences.chinese: 保險公司對保險破碎險有5%的免賠限度。

sentences.english: Back home, his father said his distress, broken will have to compensate.
sentences.chinese: 回到家，父親問明原因後說，自己打碎的就得自己賠。

sentences.english: How much must I pay for the damage?
At worst you lose the money you've invested.
sentences.chinese: 在最壞的情形下，你賠了你所投下去的錢就是了。

sentences.english: If you do things worth ￥11000, you may think you pay damage.
sentences.chinese: 如果你做11000元的事，就覺得自己賠了。

sentences.english: There is no guarantee that they make money.
sentences.chinese: 沒有保證他們穩賺不賠。

sentences.english: He'd been speculating in shares and lost a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在做股票的投機生意，賠了許多錢。

sentences.english: and some cases people can lose a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 有時候人們會賠很多錢。

definition: to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
to lose money/to pay for damages
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
just in case/if by any chance/contingency
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
guarantee/to guarantee/to ensure/to safeguard/to pledge/CL:個|个[ge4]
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
